title: ICE `assertion failed: !ty.needs_infer()`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust trait Combine<'a> { type Ty; } impl<'a, T> Combine<'a> for Box {} struct WrapC(T); impl<'a, 'x: 'a, T> Combine<'a> for WrapC where T: Combine<'a, Ty = &'a &'x ()>, { type Ty = &'a &'x (); } fn test_wrap<'a, 'b, 'c1, 'c2, A, B>( _: > as Combine<'c2>>::Ty, ) {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (696aaad58 2023-04-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 696aaad58c57a589f6fb2ecff5bae2eec581cb71 commit-date: 2023-04-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

``` error[E0261]: use of undeclared lifetime name `'main` --> treereduce.out:16:20 | 15 | fn test_wrap<'a, 'b, 'c1, 'c2, A, B>( | - help: consider introducing lifetime `'main` here: `'main,` 16 | _: > as Combine<'c2>>::Ty, | ^^^^^ undeclared lifetime error[E0601]: `main` function not found in crate `treereduce` --> treereduce.out:17:5 | 17 | ) {} | ^ consider adding a `main` function to `treereduce.out` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !ty.needs_infer()', compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/outlives_bounds.rs:58:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f1f9f764f0a - 43: 0x0 - error: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.70.0-nightly (696aaad58 2023-04-09) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: #0 [check_well_formed] checking that `test_wrap` is well-formed #1 [check_mod_type_wf] checking that types are well-formed in top-level module #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors Some errors have detailed explanations: E0261, E0601. For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0261` ```
